name: Conceptual
description: Describes the case where two objects express the same concept, allowing substitution in a conceptual architecture without changing the architecture.

name: Functional
description: Describes the case where two objects perform the same function, allowing substitution in a functional architecture without changing the architecture.

name: Logical
description: Describes the case where two objects provide the same procedure, method, technique, rules, etc., not altering a logical architecture when swapped.

name: Physical
description: Describes the case where two objects are the same in a concrete sense, such that they are interchangeable in a physical architecture.
